column4: Hey guys, I needed to know if I can accelerate the cpu or may be make programs use some specific amount of my cpu when I play suppose games,
how do I do it without getting a graphics card?
Is anyone there?
Hey guys, I needed to know if I can accelerate the cpu or may be make programs use some specific amount of my cpu when I play suppose games, without getting a graphics card?

I mean, okay for example, if I run Google earth (Just for instance), it's taking up 100% of my processor usage, and is slow, as it is using OpenGl and I don't want to have to (or want to) buy a graphics card... Is there a way to reduce the cpu usage?
not really...not to any noticable degree
amybe it will run better if google actually pulled their thumb out and made it truly native
as it is now....it's just a program wrapped in a custom wine setup
like i said...ther isnt a real native linux version
any video card that doesnt plug directly into the bus is less than desirable
:) i know ... its actually the windows code wrapped in a Qt'ified wine setup
is what opensource?
i doubt google earth is opensource or we would have a native linux version rather than this psuedo setups
its most likley related to your video cards lack of power.
this the downside to laptops
not much i can do to help you there sorry
i wouldnt imagine that an external video card via pcmia would have  the bandwidth available to it through the pcmia bus to have any improvement...
if you are aware of how agp & pci-express are linked directly to the cpu then you will find the the pcmia buss on laptops doesnt have this advantage
you can take the analogy of a v8 super car that still has a 2inch exhaust pipe...and non mandrel bent extractors...its not going to gain the benefit from having a v8 superchager
almost getting off topic here with this though
its all about throughput and bottlenecks
how far can you run full pelt if your restricted to breathing through a straw?
